column4: I'm trying to do a network install of Ubuntu (boot from a CD/USB stick, then point the installer at the network installation media).  However, the "mini.iso" that Ubuntu provides doesn't include the driver for my network hardware.  Any ideas how I can circumvent this?  (No, I don't have a floppy drive for the driver)
what is the driver ? dont you have any other network card?
It's a new Asus board, so it has an "Attansic" ethernet chipset which uses the "atl1" driver"
i don't know maby you could find search newer mini.iso  that has that module
